comment: Prof. Schramm was a delight. She is kind, cares about you, and is willing to answer any question you have. She explains grammar thoroughly. I took her online and it was all through Connect. Exams are proctored but not quizzes. You can use check my work features unlimited times. She really cares about your understanding of Spanish.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: I took this course online. I am a native speaker, and I can tell that this class would be difficult to someone that is learning for the first time. Everything is on Connect, and there is a lot of weekly assignments. I recommend this professor to anyone that already has a background in spanish as the class is kind of fast pasted. Tests are proctored

This is NOT an elementary Spanish class! This is for people who actually KNOW Spanish and want a refresher course. If I did not take 3 years in HS, I would be failing. It is absolutely TOO FAST PACED, and we are learning more than the 3 years of Spanish classes in HS within just 4 weeks. It is absolutely ridiculous!!!

Confusing. Doesn't know how to use technology super well, prepare for the class to be nothing but homework and learning out of the online textbook. Had to get a tutor to teach me stuff because prof wasn't doing much. The class might have been easier without a professor. She was really nice on my final tho, the oral final was the only good part.

I was almost fluent in Spanish, so I would put off her homework and ended up missing so many deadlines I got a D. The homework was usually easy enough to get an A on, you just gotta do it before the deadline each week. She is very nice and understanding, and she offered extra credit at the end of the semester, but you have to do your work to pass.

I took her through an online class and it wasn't that bad but there were many things that could've been improved. It was kind of all over the place especially the content on D2L. All assignments are on Connect. She also would never respond to emails. If you have to take her she isn't that bad though.

Schramm is the only online professor of Spanish when you reach 2002 (so be warned). Her class is all over the place. She tries to move between different mediums (D2L, Connect, Voiceboard, some other thing, and Skype). There's more that can be said, but ultimately, she was just a terrible professor.

Okay, it isn't that she's necessarily a terrible professor (primarily because she does zero actual teaching in this course), it's more about how disorganized and scattered this class was. She tries to utilize D2L and Connect in a way that becomes insanely overwhelming. The assignments are awful. Take a different professor. Seriously.
This was the only class I was stressing about this semester because of the amount of homework. I didn't learn a thing from this class from how confusing she makes it.

She is not the best teacher. She expects way too much of beginner speakers. For some reason, she already expects are vocabulary to be advanced. I did very well in my previous Spanish courses, but am struggling in her course. I had a 97 in the class and my grade dropped down to an 85 because of one assignment which she counted as 10% of the grade.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Do you enjoy going to a class where you are constantly forced to walk around and socialize with strangers in a language you aren't familiar with? Do you hate when professors are too clear on their grading criteria? Do you enjoy classes where a point is taken off of your final grade for every class you skip? Then boy do I have the professor for you.

The general requirements of this course are fairly easy to complete, as most of it deals with Connect homework, quizzes, and exams. The issue is with her vague instruction. She has a tendency to make everything WAY more complicated than it needs to be. The syllabus doesn't cover what you need it to. Just take someone else, man.

She is very vague in her instructions, she is unclear of expectations. When you email her she takes days to respond. She never gives feedback, therefore you in the dark on a lot of things. She expects a lot out of your skills and pronunciation too early on. I regret taking this course and will not take her again. Made me question minoring in spans
Good teacher, with a good job of expplaining.  Very fair.  Others just don't do homework and complain.  I got an A with minimal effort.  Highly recommend.

worst teacher ever.She is very rude and disrespectful  and won't answer any of your questions. It's hard to understand her because she has a thick accent. I am an A & B student my GPA is now dropped because of her class. I, now hate Spanish because of her. DO NOT TAKE HER!!!
She is a very good teacher.  She has you practice what you would need to say when working in the field as an officer.  Do not take this class if you are looking for an easy A.

Nice lady but terrible teacher of Beginning Spanish. I wish I had read the comments on this site earlier before enrolling in her class. She is from Venezuela and has a very think Spanish accent. This may be a plus for your third year of Spanish but not for beginners. Wow! She was somewhat unorganized too. Not a great teacher for beginners

Very difficult to understand because of her heavy accent and on top of that, she has a hard time understanding students when they ask questions. Strict attendance policy and grading system. No compassion for those that struggle in class and her only answer is to go to the foreign language lab. Worked my butt off in her class. Proudest B I ever got!

She is terrible. This is a second semester freshman level class that should not be this hard. She doesn't review for tests and has no real teaching style. She gets off topic easily. You're better learning on your own. She is a strict grader as well. She expects all answers to be %100 or nothing, even though the tests are subjective. Take M. Raburn.
She's ok. If you haven't had any Spanish classes before she is difficult to understand. She is a native speaker.

Let me remind Spanish major students that are/were bored in the class this class was not designed for Spanish Majors. This class was designed to aid Law Enforcement Officers, and Criminal Justice Majors.  This class introduces useful Spanish law enforcement vocabulary that will apply  to the officers on patrol.

She is fair and helpful.  The class is difficult for anyone that hasn't taken a Spanish class before.  There are prerequisites for this class but the school waves them.  It makes it difficult for the teacher and students taking Spanish 2034 for Criminal Justice.
